description: personal study ID composed by the first authors’ first surname_year of publication_first title word
number of experiment from publication
name of data subset –  afternoon observations
year the data point was obtained
month the data point was obtained
day of the month the data point was obtained
name of the participant
age presented in years – see metadata for source of age
sex of the participant
species of individuals participating in the study -bonobo/chimpanzee/gorilla/orangutan
observation period- two 14-day periods- nonoverlapping within 60 days
observation day within 60 day observation period, consecutively numbered
number of instantaneous observation point within a given observation day
whether the participant were within 2 m of proximity  to their conspecifics during observation - 0 (if not) / the name of the conspecific (if yes)
body contact with their conspecifics for longer than 5 seconds during observation - 0 (if not) / the name of the conspecific (if yes) / b-ub (Ulindi baby Luiza)
whether the participant gave grooming to the conspecifics
whether the participant received grooming from the conspecifics
whether auto grooming occurred during observation
whether the participant showed self care such as licking or touching their own body during observation
whether the participant scratched their own body
whether nursing a child occurred during observation – b-ub (Ulindi baby Luiza)

whether allo play (social play with adolescent
or adult conspecifics) occurred during observation
whether solitary play without object occurred
whether the participant played with an object during observation
whether allo sex occurred during observation
whether auto sex occurred during observation
whether vigilance occurred during the observation or not – vigilance here refers to looking at observer
whether feeding occurred during observation
whether and which of the following activities occurred - l(locate)/ m(move)/ r(rest)
